p: In conclusion, SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 bind cells expressing ACE2. They affect the RAS system due to the affinity for ACE2 (much stronger with SARS-CoV-2 than with SARS-CoV), leading to the onset of symptoms. MERS-CoV causes symptoms by producing inflammatory cytokines and invading T cells. The specific pathogenic mechanisms of these three viruses are illustrated in Fig. 4.
